newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African seed cotton producer price hiked 9.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: S.African seed cotton producer price hiked 9.1 pct.

text.p: The 1997 producer price for basic grade hand picked seed cotton in South Africa has been increased 9.1 percent to 2.40 per kg, the Cotton Board said on Friday.
The seed price increase is appreciably above the 7.4 percent increase for basic grade cotton lint to 7.95 per kg, a move which ginners said was designed to encourage production.

"This should be seen as a concession from the cotton ginners to encourage future cotton production amongst commercial as well as small producers," said Dries Fourie, chairman of the Cotton Ginners Association.
Fourie noted that local lint demand was running well ahead of production.
